page.title: 15LANGUAGE AROUND POYNTINGTON
page.content: The majority of people in this area were educated elsewhere and speak versions of B.B.C. English.However a distinctive{local dialect}can still be heard in the public bars of nearby pubs.The brogue characteristic of Dorset and Somerset is typified by the poetry of William Barnes.{Specific {aspects are:}the use of personal pronouns (She/He/They) when others would use the impersonal form (It/Those);substituting "Z" for "S" and "V" for "F";missing of ends of words eg "wi" for "with","an" for "and","go" for "got"; omitting auxilliary verbs eg "Where going?" for "Where are you going?".
